description: A Bengaluru college had asked a Sikh student to remove her turban in light of the interim order of the Karnataka High Court. A three-judge Bench is hearing a batch of pleas against the hijab ban on campuses and had passed an interim order on February 10, barring students from wearing religious attire in institutions where there is an existing uniform mandate. Citing this, Mount Carmel PU College asked the 17-year-old student, who is an Amritdhari Sikh, if she could remove her turban while attending classes.
